page.title: 06The M5 motorway
page.content: The M5 was the third motorway to be opened in England 25 years ago. It only has 2 lanes in each direction and is very busy. About 40000 vehicles use the motorway each day so now the motorway is being widened. It is causing great difficulties because the traffic has to use the hard shoulder as a road. Only 3 houses have had to be demolished. Wherever possible it is widened on both sides but near Hanbury Road, Droitwich all the widening is to be on one side because of a bank of trees and houses. Where the banks are softer the job is easier. In the winter they have to pay Â£3000 a night ot grit the road. Only one engineer has been killed working on the motorway. There are things called sky cradles which they put across the road to hold the electricity cables when they are being moved.
